title: Sr. Systems Analyst, Applications
description:
POSITION SUMMARY Under the direction and guidance of the Director IT or Manager, this software development/systems professional is responsible for developing and/or supporting a broad range software of applications, integration solutions and systems for Versiti. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Applies expertise in the technical architecture design, development, delivery and support of software application solutions and system interfaces to meet business requirements following departmental standards and best practices
  • Develops reports and queries to aid business and service lines
  • Performs and/or assists with required maintenance and upgrades of assigned systems/solutions
  • Assists in the evaluation and selection of off-the-the shelf solutions and systems, as well as technologies, and plays a key role in implementation, integration, and maintenance of those systems and technologies.
  • Establishes strong working and consultative relationships with business partner and users, vendors and internal staff
  • Develops estimates for assigned work and manages time and work plans effectively to meet deadlines, provides routine updates to appropriate business and IS teams.
  • Working with extended development team and management, assists in establishment of policies, processes, procedures and standards including coding standards, testing, etc.
  • Assists peers in design and development efforts by being an active participant in code walkthroughs and design reviews
  • Performs other duties as required.

QUALIFICATIONS

Education

  • BS from an accredited institution; Computer Science, Software Engineering, Management Information Systems degree preferred; equivalent work experience may be considered
  • ITIL foundation certification a definite plus

  Experience, Skills and Knowledge – Clinical and Research Systems and Software Development

  • 5-8 years of progressive responsibility and experience in application development and support, with at least 3 years of demonstrated systems analysis and design experience.
  • Experience in laboratory, hospital, pharma or healthcare solutions and/or integrations a definite plus
  • Demonstrated understanding and appreciation of structure software development and support lifecycle disciplines
  • Experience working in a Regulated industry like healthcare, banking etc. with knowledge of privacy and compliance regulations such as HIPAA, GDPR preferred
  • Good communication and listening skills, with an ability to translate business requests and requirements into proposed technical solutions
  • Understands the need to balance technical solutions with practical business needs and short-term vs long-term approaches
  • Strong collaborator and team player, with the ability to partner well with users, peers, internal and external/vendor partners and management
  • Motivated, self-starter, self-directed, results-oriented

Key Development Tools

  • Database and report development: MS SQL Server and Oracle; SQL to develop queries, stored procedures, reports and analytics
  • Reporting tools: Power BI, Business Objects
  • CCL for Cerner
  • Java, VBA and/or Python scripting

Key Application Technologies and Environments in Use/Supported

  • Cerner Laboratory
  • Surround
  • Oracle and MS SQL Server databases
  • Operating systems: Unix/Linux and Windows

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & WORKING CONDITIONS

  • This role can require providing system support coverage during off hours.

This job description reflects the current assignment of essential functions and is not meant to be all-inclusive or in any way construed as an employment contract. Duties and responsibilities may be assigned or reassigned to this position at any time and may be modified to reasonably accommodate an individual with a disability or for other reasons solely at management’s discretion. All position descriptions will be reviewed and updated at least once per year when the incumbent is reviewed or as attrition occurs

title: Full Stack Web Development Instructor
description:
About Pursuit

Pursuit is a social impact organization that creates transformation where it’s needed most. Through our intensive software developer training program, we teach high-need, high-potential adults the technical skills and industry smarts needed to get their first tech jobs, advance in their careers, and become the next generation of leaders in tech. In addition to training and career support, Pursuit’s innovative operating model combines partnerships with tech companies to retrain their blue-collar workers and social impact investments to re-envision funding for outcomes-based organizations.

About the Role

At Pursuit, all employees have the opportunity to make a profound, positive social impact. Our Web Instructors perhaps have the greatest direct impact on our program participants and we are hiring several instructors to support our program expansion. As an Instructor, you will manage a class of approximately 36 Fellows with no technical background to become job-ready over a 12-month period. Instructors will deliver technical curriculum, provide feedback to Fellows and create a positive learning environment. We are hiring instructors at all levels, from associate to lead instructor.

Our office is located in Long Island City, NY but we are currently fully remote due to Coronavirus, including our classes, and will remain so for the entirety of 2021.

Cohorts have two schedules: Days (Monday - Friday 10:00 - 6:00) and Nights & Weekends (Saturday & Sunday 10:00 - 6:00; Monday - Wednesday 2:00 - 10:00pm)

About You

  • You are passionate about teaching and mentoring, and have a strong connection to our mission
  • You have demonstrated professional experience working with front end and back end javascript, for example Node.js, React/Redux, and Postgres
  • You have a no-fail attitude and love working with a big cross-functional team
  • You are compassionate and able to work with a broad range of students

Key Responsibilities

  • Deliver full-class instruction - currently remote over Zoom
  • Lead small-group and one-on-one sessions for fellows in need of additional review
  • Monitor chat and answer fellow questions
  • Grade fellow work; offer robust written and verbal feedback to fellows
  • Spearhead workshops and activities that respond to the needs of cohort
  • Build and refine curriculum materials
  • Assess individual Fellows and support forecasting efforts to meet org goals

Requirements

  • 2+ years experience in a technical instruction or technical role
  • Demonstrated experience developing web applications using JavaScript and React
  • Passion for teaching and mentorship
  • Knowledge of our tech stack: Postgres - Express - React/Redux - Node.js, aka PERN
  • Strong work ethic and reliability

Nice to have Jest, Cypress, React Testing Library/Enzyme, and automation platforms such as CircleCI

This is a full-time, salaried position with competitive compensation and a wide range of benefits. Our offerings include premium health, dental, and vision insurance, flexible paid time off, and robust 401k matching.
how_to_apply: Email your resume to talent@pursuit.org and please indicate which schedule you prefer.

company: CTI Clinical Trial and Consulting Services, Inc.
title: Senior Developer
description:
Job Purpose / Summary: The Senior Developer works with system owners to understand the business requirements of a system and is able to use various technologies to develop the supporting infrastructure and user interfaces. This can involve working with data from a variety of sources and developing the most efficient methods to manage data flow. The Senior Developer communicates with both internal and external clients during all phases of system development, working within agreed upon budget and timelines. The Senior Developer is proficient with industry best practices for processes and development technologies, and serves as a resource and mentor to other developers.

What You'll Do: Work with system owners to develop requirements and transform into a usable system within the systems development life cycle (SDLC) framework Develop custom databases and user interfaces using standard web and database technologies such as Microsoft SQL, Microsoft SSRS, Microsoft C#, etc. Develop extract, transform, and load (ETL) processes on complex data sets Prepare reports, tables, charts, and graphs using Tableau and Microsoft SSRS Development work in systems such as Medidata suite, SharePoint, and Intacct Work with and support other developers to create and implement best practices for processes and systems; provide leadership to other developers Communicate results within the organization and to clients Follow applicable Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and maintain appropriate project documentation Perform, track, and manage related project work as assigned Identify areas for improvement and provides recommendations to address Adhere to requirements of 21 CFR Part 11 where applicable

What You'll Bring: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field 5 years industry experience in related field Experience with Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft SSRS, SQL, Microsoft C#, and Tableau

Why CTI?: We support career progression – We have a structured mentoring program to provide the support you need to move forward We value education and training – We provide tuition reimbursement, partner with universities and colleges to create programs in our field, and have a dedicated training department We value our people - We have never had a layoff in our 20-year history, support a work-life balance, and have provided cash bonuses every year for the past decade Our culture is unparalleled – We've received multiple awards recognizing CTI as one of the best places to work in the greater Cincinnati area, as well as one of the top CROs in the industry We think globally and act locally – We have a global philanthropic program supporting our team’s efforts to improve their local communities (click here to learn more about our “CTI Cares” program) We are looking toward the future – We have had a consistent double-digit growth rate over the last decade, invest in cutting-edge technology, and pride ourselves on our average 95% annual retention rate (a recent report found that the average turnover for CROs in the US was 30%) Our work makes a difference – We focus our work on treatments for chronically and critically-ill patients, who are depending on us to bring these life-changing therapies to market

title: Senior Java Developer (m/w/d)
description:
Für unseren Geschäftsbereich Software am Standort Siemensdamm in Berlin suchen wir Senior Java Entwickler (m/w/d)

Dabei verbinden wir in unserem Portfolio das klassische IT-Systemhausgeschäft mit unseren eigenen Softwarelösungen zur Digitalisierung von Geschäftsprozessen. arxes-tolina GmbH verfügt über fast 30 Jahre Erfahrung bei der Entwicklung von intelligenten Softwarelösungen zum Automatisieren und Optimieren von Geschäftsprozessen, die kundenindividuell gestaltet und über Schnittstellen schnell und effizient in bestehende IT-Infrastrukturen integriert werden können.

Mit unserer Low-Code-Plattform smardigo setzen wir auf eine einfache und schnelle digitale Transformation von Geschäftsprozessen mittels BPMN. In Kombination mit unserer Automatisierungsplattform Camino und unserem End-to-End verschlüsselten Austauschhub e-DEN bieten wir unseren Kunden somit eine Komplettlösung zur Digitalisierung von Geschäftsprozessen.

Wir bieten unseren Kunden im Rahmen unseres Consulting-Services branchenübergreifendes Wissen in verschiedensten Fachbereichen, unter anderem durch langjährige Praxiserfahrung aus zahllosen erfolgreichen Kundenprojekten, an. So begleiten wir namenhafte Unternehmen und öffentliche Auftraggeber als Digitalisierungspartner auf ihrem Weg in ein zukunftsfähiges Geschäftsmodell. Als arxes-tolina Team verfolgen wir das Ziel einer der TOP Digitalisierungspartner in Deutschland zu sein und gemeinsam mit der neu gewonnenen Unterstützung der netgo group werden wir zum „Digital Gamechanger“.

Proud to be part of netgo group

Als Senior Java Entwickler erwartet dich bei uns:

  • Agile Software-Entwicklung mit Scrum oder Kanban
  • Spannende und abwechslungsreiche Projekte zur Unterstützung der digitalen Transformation
  • Entwicklung von innovativen Lösungen mit modernen Web Technologien und nach dem Clean-Code-Prinzipien
  • Unterstützung des Product Owners bei der Konzeption von Kundenanforderungen und technischen Umsetzung im Team
  • Selbstorganisierte Teams mit einer flachen Hierarchie
  • Kreatives Arbeiten und das Ausprobieren neuer Technologien

Das wünschen wir von dir:

  • Du bringst mehrjährige Berufserfahrung als Softwareentwickler mit, idealerweise auch in Softwarearchitektur und -konzeption
  • Du fühlst dich als Fullstack-Entwickler wohl (Frontend - SPA z.B. Angular, React, VueJS, Vaadin und/oder Backend - Java, Spring, JPA(Hibernate), SQL, Buildprozesse CD/CI)
  • Du hast einen hohen Anspruch an Code-Qualität, Design und die Schaffung einer agilen Software-Architektur
  • Du arbeitest dich schnell in neue Themen und Technologien ein
  • Du hast Erfahrung mit agilen Softwareentwicklungsmethoden
  • Du bringst dich mit deiner Kommunikationsfähigkeit ins Team bzw. beim Kunden ein
  • Deine Deutschkenntnisse sind verhandlungssicher in Wort und Schrift
  • Pluspunkte geben Erfahrung im Mentoring, Elastic-Stack und Docker

arxes-tolina bietet dir:

  • Einen Job in einem zukunftsweisenden und wachsenden Unternehmen
  • Gestaltungsspielraum und hohe Einflussmöglichkeiten auf die eigene Arbeit für deine persönliche Entfaltung
  • Eine angenehme offene und familiäre Arbeitsatmosphäre in unseren Teams sowie unternehmensübergreifend zwischen den Mitarbeiter*Innen.
  • Ein Mentoringprogramm und ein Einarbeitungsplan für deinen gelungenen Einstieg
  • Eine offene Kommunikationskultur, in der auch „der Elefant im Raum“ angesprochen werden kann
  • Wir sorgen mit Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten für deine persönliche und berufliche Entwicklung
  • Betriebliche Altersvorsorge für dich und deine Familie
  • Mit einem JobRad, unserem Remotework-Konzept sowie deiner flexiblen Arbeitszeitgestaltung steht deiner Work-Life-Balance nichts mehr im Weg!
  • Du kommst mit dem öffentlichen Nahverkehr zur Arbeit? Dann nutze unseren BVG- Zuschuss!

title: Backend Developer - (m/f/d)
description:
Smart Pricer is the leading ticket pricing company in Europe. We offer pricing services in the areas of sports, entertainment and ski resorts and are proud to work with partners such as FC Bayern Munich, DFB, Hertha BSC, Sölden ski resort, Zermatt Bergbahnen and many more. Our work is characterized by entrepreneurial thinking, effective transaction management and innovative solutions. We owe our success as one of the world's leading specialists in our field not least to a distinctly team-oriented approach.

Together we want to grow further and are therefore looking for a

Backend Developer - (m/f/d)

to support us as soon as possible.

With us, you are part of a committed and motivated team that rethinks the way pricing is done with a lot of enthusiasm and drive from Berlin. If you want to take on responsibility from day one and drive our mission forward with your own ideas, then your application is just right with us.

Your Responsibilities:

  • Within the first three months, you will familiarize yourself with our existing services (you have access to documentations and team members)
  • You will lead and own the development of our back-end pricing services incl. the design and deployment of APIs to run our services
  • Your responsibilities will range - from rapidly building prototypes in product discovery phase, to delivering reliable quality products in delivery phase, to developing our tech architecture further ensuring functionality, scalability, reliability and security (a hands-on mind-set and strategic oversight are essential for this)
  • You will define the technical requirements of the company in detail and set up all required processes
  • In 6-9 month time you will start to build and manage a small technical team of A-players (including software engineers, data scientists)
  • Together with the founders you and your team will continuously iterate our product by developing hypotheses, validating them (e.g. through user research and tests) and shipping new features
  • You own the operative KPIs tech and will be the voice of tech in all strategic decisions
  • You oversee the monitoring of our live pricing services

Requirements:

  • Software Developer with a degree in a technical related field such as Computer Science, Bio/Informations or similar
  • You have at least 3 years experience working in Software Development
  • You are skilled in several backend languages (Go, Ruby) and in working with and deploying cloud services in a Unix environment
  • Optionally you have some frontend experience in TypeScript and CoffeeScript as well as some data analytics background in Python
  • You combine a strong hands-on-attitude (and are happy to develop and maintain code yourself) with strategic thinking and an entrepreneurial mindset
  • You have a high focus on customer needs and contribute your best knowledge and experience about technology, products and processes
  • You are interested in pricing, data mining, ML
  • You are characterized by a sovereign appearance as well as good presentation and communication skills
  • You are fluent in English and German

What We Offer:

  • A friendly and respectful team with a family work culture
  • A great workplace in Berlin Mitte with a part-time remote work option
  • The chance to take over a large area of expertise very quickly and to make a steep entry into a management position
  • An attractive compensation package
  • Flexible working hours
  • A secure employment relationship
  • Meaning - our work has direct impact on sports and entertainment pricing across all of Europe
how_to_apply: We are happy to receiving your application by e-mail, stating your desired salary and earliest possible starting date, at: miriam.weber@smart-pricer.com

Your tasks:

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
As a DevOps engineer at ORTEC, one of your main goals is to empower our 130+ software developers around the globe with regards to our software development tools. This means maintenance on existing tools and R&D and implementation of new systems & tools supporting our product transition to the cloud (Azure)

Our team of DevOps - and System engineers is the spinning wheel in the software and product development unit. As a DevOps engineer you work on technical projects.

The team maintains, improves, migrates, and supports all the development systems and tooling that are needed to keep the software and product development empowered and productive. The team is responsible for a versatile portfolio like:

  • Continuous integration and Continuous deployment environment (Jenkins, Azure DevOps, Team city)
  • Version control system (Perforce & Git)
  • Test case management software (Testrail)
  • NuGet repository management (Nexus)
  • Issue and project software (Jira, Azure DevOps)
  • Virtual Machines (vSphere and HyperV) for software & test engineers with the required tooling to do the job! And more…

The team is growing towards a team of four to five DevOps - and System engineers. It is also responsible for all integrations between the systems & tools. Next to that, the system engineers maintain and develop all automation to deploy and update the systems & tools.

It is important that you embrace the “DevOps” culture. If people have questions or want support and advice regarding (cloud) infrastructure, automation or the best tooling for the job, you are the “go to” person. We also monitor that the software is automatically build, tested and deployed in the cloud using our continuous integration and continuous delivery pipelines. You work close together with the IT department and you keep aligned with other internal stakeholders.

Who you are

  • You embrace the DevOps culture
  • Automating is your second nature
  • You have knowledge of Virtualization, PowerShell and Windows Server Platform
  • You can learn quickly to understand Jira, Perforce, Git, etc.
  • You have a relevant bachelor’s degree
  • You like to consult others, but also to do the work yourself
  • You have 2+ years of relevant working experience
  • Willingness to take part in on-call duties to support our customers 24/7 (approx. 8 weeks per year).You will be generously compensated

What we offer

We are a small, relatively new growing team and with that you will find a ‘start-up’-atmosphere which gives you ample opportunity to explore, learn and grow, and make it your team.

  • Entrance to the most passionate powerhouse in applied mathematics
  • Join our movement and improve the world
  • Enjoy an open, kind and fun culture
  • NS Business Card 100%, NS Business Card, lease opportunity or commuting allowance: it’s your choice
  • Mobility allowance of 3% of your base salary
  • 25 annual leave days, additional days from the age of 35
  • Result related remuneration
  • Active employee association for fun activities with colleagues and content driven Young ORTEC for you to join
  • We help you to #stayhealthy, to #stayeffective and to #stayconnected: we organize online activities such as pub quizzes, online sports events, social calls with colleagues, and much more
  • Year-end bonus equal to a full month’s pay
  • We believe in commitment: your permanent contract will be waiting for you

What to expect

We will help you to thrive in your field of expertise. We offer development programs, tailored to your individual needs and function requirements, including opportunities to attend courses and seminars. We offer challenging, practical hands-on experience with opportunities to work abroad. We operate in a flat organizational structure that keeps communication lines short. The atmosphere is open, informal, cooperative and positive. We employ over 1000 people in the Netherlands (HQ), Belgium, Germany, France, the U.K., Romania, Italy, the U.S., Australia, Brazil, Poland, Denmark and Singapore. Visit our website www.ortec.com to learn more about our solutions and clients’ experiences.

Please do not use this vacancy as an acquisition opportunity.

Interested?

Apply now via the application form

Click here for the application form!

title: Electronics Test Engineer
description:
Company Description

The Invinity team is growing rapidly, and we’re looking for people with a passion for renewable energy to join us at this remarkable point in our growth.

We are an emerging global cleantech leader; well-funded with category-leading technology. Our culture is collaborative, entrepreneurial, and one in which speaking up is encouraged and ideas are chosen on merit not who they come from.

People love working at Invinity because we know we are empowered to make a meaningful impact. We’re small enough that every team member plays a critical role in our daily business, but large enough that the batteries we build are being deployed at significant scale in landmark clean energy projects around the world.

Whether you are a cleantech veteran or looking to make a career shift, Invinity offers you a chance to work as part of an expert team located across multiple geographies, aligned in our mission to build a sustainable energy future.

Invinity is committed to providing equal opportunities in the workplace and follows a comprehensive Equal Opportunities Policy to ensure all employees are valued and can reach their full potential.

Job Description

As the world transitions to a renewable energy future, large-scale energy storage systems are required to bridge the gap between intervals of renewable energy production. Invinity Energy Systems, listed on the London Stock Exchange, is the leader in vanadium flow batteries, a proven technology addressing the global demand for energy storage.

Invinity is seeking an Electronics Test Engineer to join its product development team. This role will work closely with the electronics design team to develop and conduct comprehensive verification test plans. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining the testing infrastructure and equipment necessary to verify robust designs and design the test methods. You will work closely with other teams to establish and conduct various integration tests and provide detailed reports back to design teams.

Responsibilities

  • Design, source, and build test electronic test equipment including complex electronic test benches.
  • Work with electronics design team to create test plans and conduct tests.
  • Support root cause analysis and troubleshooting of field failures of electronic components.
  • Engage with contract electronic designers, reviewing and auditing test plans.
  • Support and conduct product certification testing, working with third-party testing labs to provide equipment.

Qualifications

  • 5+ years experience testing and/or designing electronic systems and related components.
  • Experience working with high voltage AC and DC electronic systems and related test equipment: power supplies, oscilloscopes, dataloggers, etc.
  • Strong documentation skills, writing and reviewing test plans and reports.
  • Experience working in a structured product development environment.
  • Able to read and understand DFMEA and various design documentation.
  • Experience working with contract design and development teams. Proficiency working hands-on with electronics and printed circuit board assemblies, capable of reworking through-hole and SMD components.

Desirable

  • Capable of developing interface software programming (LabVIEW, Python, other) to support use and automation of test equipment.

Additional Information

If the idea of building a world-class development team and helping the world transition to renewable energy is exciting to you. If being a part of a dynamic, global company where the team works with passion but not ego sounds appealing, Invinity may just be where you belong.
how_to_apply: Click here for the application form!

title: Fullstack Developer (m/f/d) @Footprint in Berlin
description:
We are DONE! Berlin, an international consultancy specializing in helping fast-growing companies of all sizes to navigate the ever-changing world of work. Among other things, we help our clients attract the best talent to their companies.

Our client Footprint Technologies GmbH is a young, ambitious start-up located in Berlin. The company's mission is to develop a technology that allows online shoppers to easily and accurately measure their feet at home in order to always find the perfect fitting shoe. With this solution, online retailers will reduce their returns, costs and emissions. In product development Footprint consistently places the user and data insights at the center of all activities and decisions.

To help Footprint achieve its mission, we are looking for a talented Fullstack developer (m/f/d). You’re a smart person with a strong drive and keen to work in a collaborative culture? Great! Because we want you to take the initiative to move Footprint forward by bringing in your own ideas.

Tasks

  • Develop multi-platform web frontends for mobile and desktop
  • Conceptualize, implement and maintain user-facing features for Footprint's products
  • Design and develop backend APIs
  • Develop reusable libraries
  • Optimize the applications for performance and responsiveness
  • Support maintaining CI/CD pipelines and databases in the cloud
  • Develop web frontend applications when needed

Requirements

  • Ideally a completed degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field
  • Around 5 years of experience in developing web applications in cloud, ideally using node.js/ nest.js and Typescript
  • Proven experience in developing frontend projects, ideally using React and Typescript/ JavaScript with HTML5 and CSS
  • Good understanding of Test-driven development (TDD), CI/CD pipelines, DevOps principles and MS-Azure
  • Having fun in solving complex problems
  • Good level of English (C1 Level minimum)

Nice to Have

  • Experience with Kubernetes and Docker
  • Experience in using Grafana and Sentry (or similar)
  • Experience in developing with C# and Go for cloud applications

Benefits

Being transparent is the best way for Footprint to find solutions and grow together. The team pursues a culture where they frankly address anything that concerns them or affects their work. They bring in a rich combination of skillsets and individual strengths, making them a powerful team.

  • Steep learning curve by working independently in your own field within Footprint's fabulous development team
  • Opportunity to further develop your experience by certified trainings when required
  • Maximum freedom and trust in terms of your working time, location and holidays
  • Guidance and coaching whenever needed as well as support in finding the right mentors from our broad network of experts
  • Fair and transparent compensation model
  • And yes - fresh fruits and unlimited coffee are guaranteed! So are team lunches and beers as soon as we're allowed to have them again!

Looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Front End Software Engineer (m/f/d)
description:

Mission

Enable millions of people to get the right size when shopping online by integrating Presize with leading fashion eCommerce vendors. Work closely with major online shops to ensure the success of each new project, release groundbreaking new features, and build a world-class UX, to help many more people return much fewer packages.

title: Front-end developer
description:
ValueWorks is a management platform to help executives and managers make data-driven management decisions. We enable them to manage and measure the performance of their business by integrating the data from different information systems (JIRA, Salesforce, LinkedIn,) to build KPIs and OKRs.

We are looking for a front-end developer to build and implement our user interface. You will work with our small team consisting of developers, founders and a UX designer. We provide an opportunity to become full-stack by teaching you python and django.

Benefits

  • Bootstrap experience
  • Eagerness to become a full stack developer
  • Experience working with relational databases
  • We are looking forward to your application.

title: Junior System Engineer IT Infrastructure
description:
Job description

Have you just finished your studies or already have experience in IT and you want to play a key role in the functionality of all ORTEC IT products worldwide? Do you want to develop yourself further in the world of IT infrastructure as a (junior/medior) System Engineer IT Infrastructure? Then keep reading!

ORTEC is world leader in optimizing business processes and enriching data, which enables our customers to be more efficient, profitable and competitive. With our mathematical knowledge, clever algorithms, data science models and software engineering skills, we support global companies in making smart strategic, tactical as well as real-time operational decisions.

In this role as Junior/Medior System Engineer IT Infrastructure, you are part of the Infra Team and you manage, monitor, extend and improve our IT infrastructure globally. You participate in various projects. Key tasks consist of preparing, executing and administration of projects.

You work together with your team on functional and technical maintenance tasks, developing, testing, accepting and implementing of changes and solving third line requests. Using your analytical skills as well as your experience and knowledge you are a knowledgeable sparring partner for the business. Together with your team members you anticipate on how the current infrastructure should develop and how to adapt new technologies beneficial to ORTEC.

The IT department consist of about 30 people, where your team contains 6 including yourself. We have an informal, social atmosphere within the IT department; we go for lunch together, we meet online, we organize events, we know how to have fun, and we share personal stories just as well. And of course we work together a lot, as we believe we all have our strengths and combined we will come to the best solution possible.

Do you like to be part of our journey to (continuous) success? Then apply online today, or contact Falko Hage (Recruiter) at recruitment@ortec.com for more information.

Who you are

  • A bachelor’s degree in computer science or comparable level gained through experience
  • You are currently living in the Netherlands and are able to fluently communicate in Dutch and English (verbally and in writing)
  • You have 2+ years of experience in IT or are a recent bachelor graduate eager and able to quickly grow into this role.
  • Experienced in:
    • Microsoft Windows systems
    • Virtualization platform Hyper-V VMM (VMWare is a preference)
    • Network protocols such as TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP and VPN
  • Knowledge of storage (Microsoft Storage Space Direct), switching/ routing technology and firewalls is a preference
  • Analytical, with the ability to translate towards solutions
  • You prefferably have experience in projects and are used to delivering a high standard of quality.
  • You are open-minded to the ideas of others, and understand the different (cultural) perspectives and you are able to convey your ideas to others

What we offer

  • Entrance to the most passionate powerhouse in applied mathematics
  • We believe in commitment: your permanent contract will be waiting for you
  • An open, kind and fun culture
  • NS Business Card, lease opportunity or commuting allowance: it’s your choice
  • Mobility allowance of 3% of your base salary
  • 25 annual leave days, additional days from the age of 35
  • Result related remuneration
  • Year-end bonus equal to a full month’s pay
  • Development tailored to your needs, including opportunities to attend courses and seminars
  • Active employee association for fun activities with colleagues and content driven Young ORTEC for you to join
  • Football table, our own bar the “ORtap”, Christmas party, annual barbecue at one of our founders’ home, and much more

What to expect

We help you to thrive in your field of expertise. We offer development programs, tailored to your individual needs and function requirements, including opportunities to attend courses and seminars. We offer challenging practical hands-on experience with opportunities to work abroad. We operate a flat organizational structure that keeps communication lines short. The atmosphere is open, informal, cooperative and positive. We employ over 1000 people in the Netherlands (HQ), Belgium, Germany, France, the U.K., Romania, Italy, the U.S., Australia, Brazil, Poland and Denmark.

Visit our website www.ortec.com to learn more about our solutions and clients' experiences.

Interested?

Click here for the application form!

Acquisition as a result of this vacancy is not appreciated.

title: Senior Software Engineer Web Front-end
description:
ti&m steht für technology, innovation & management. Wir sind Leader für Digitalisierungs-, Security-, Innovationsprojekte und -produkte in der Schweiz und streben dasselbe in weiteren Finanz- und Technologiezentren an. Dabei integrieren wir für unsere anspruchsvollen Kunden die gesamte IT-Wertschöpfungskette vertikal. In unseren Niederlassungen in Zürich, Bern, Frankfurt am Main und Singapur beschäftigen wir aktuell über 400 exzellente Ingenieure, Designer und Berater. Weitere Niederlassungen werden folgen. Die Grundlage unseres Wachstums sind unsere Stärken und unsere Werte: Mut, Ideenreichtum, Agilität und unternehmerisches Flair gepaart mit Nachhaltigkeit und Swissness.

Wen wir suchen:

Im Rahmen unseres starken Wachstums suchen wir für die Beratung unserer Kunden und die Umsetzung von Projekten im Bereich Web-Applikationen interessierte Persönlichkeiten als Senior Software-Ingenieur Web-Frontend. Die anspruchsvollen Tätigkeiten setzen einen (Fach-) Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, ausgewiesene Berufserfahrung, stilsicheres Deutsch und Englisch in Wort und Schrift, Flexibilität, Einsatzbereitschaft und Interesse am Umgang mit Kunden und Mitarbeitenden voraus.

Was dich erwartet:

  • Unterstützung bei der Analyse, Konzeption und der Umsetzung von komplexen Projekten im Bereich Web-, CMS-, Shop- und Portallösungen mit Fokus Frontend
  • Mitarbeit bei technischen Lösungskonzepten sowie Abwicklung von Beratungsmandaten im Web-Frontend Umfeld

Was du mitbringen solltest:

  • Mehrjährige Erfahrung in Konzeption, Design und Umsetzung von Frontend-Lösungen mittels modernen Web-Technologien (HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript/TypeScript)
  • Erfahrung in der Umsetzung von grafischen Entwürfen für unterschiedliche Ausgabemedien (Desktop und mobile Endgeräte, Responsive Webdesign)
  • Fähigkeit, Kompatibilität für die verschiedenen Web-Browser sicherzustellen
  • Profunde Kenntnisse in mindestens einem JavaScript-Framework wie React oder Angular
  • Erfahrung mit Build-Tools wie Webpack oder Grunt
  • Erfahrungen und Know-how mit CSS-Precompilern wie SASS/SCSS, Stylus oder LESS
  • Erfahrung mit Unit- und e2e-Testing Tools wie Jest, Karma, Jasmine, Protractor oder ähnlichen Tools

Was wir bieten:

Unsere Mitarbeitenden wählten uns zu einem der besten Arbeitgeber der Schweiz. Als Gewinner von Best of Swiss Apps und vom Digital Economy Award surfst du mit uns an der Spitze der technologischen Entwicklung. Zudem erlebst du bei uns ein interessantes und dynamisches Umfeld, abwechslungsreiche Arbeit an aufregenden Projekten mit Mut für Innovation, ein kollegiales Arbeitsklima und flexible Arbeitszeiten. Mit ti&m liquid working bieten wir dir ausserdem einfach anpassbare Arbeitszeitmodelle und die Möglichkeit Auszeiten zu nehmen. Die ti&m academy ermöglicht dir konstante Weiterbildung am Puls der Zeit.

title: Web-Developer (m,w,d)
description:
Wir, das Team von vOffice, tun alles dafür, um unseren Kunden die Arbeit zu erleichtern. Unsere Software macht die Verwaltung und Organisation von Ferienobjekten zum Kinderspiel. Von der Onlinebuchung auf unseren Websites bis zur Team-Einsatzplanung wird alles über unsere moderne Cloudsoftware abgewickelt. Als schnell wachsendes Unternehmen und Marktführer in Deutschland benötigen wir tatkräftige Unterstützung im Bereich Web-Entwicklung.

Aufgaben

Jeder unserer Kunden braucht eine tolle Webseite. Viele nutzen dafür unser in-house-Angebot, dass auf unserem custom CMS beruht. Du richtest darin neue Websites ein, d.h. Du integrierst die individuellen Anforderungen in die vorhandenen Templates. Du entwickelst die Templates weiter, damit jeder unserer Kunden das Passende findet. Und Du hilfst unseren Bestandskunden, ihre Websites zu verbessern und zu aktualisieren.

Qualifikation

  • Fundierte Kenntnisse in der Webseiten-Entwicklung: CSS (LESS/Post CSS), Javascript, webpack, Erfahrung mit Vue.js von Vorteil
  • Autonome und strukturierte Arbeitsweise
  • Zielorientierter Teamplayer, den nichts so schnell aus der Ruhe bringt
  • Englisch (verhandlungssicher)

Benefits

  • Werde Teil eines sympathischen Teams in einem dynamischen Umfeld
  • Viel Handlungsspielraum, kurze Abstimmungswege
  • Ein flexibles, familienfreundliches Arbeitszeitmodell
  • Ein modern ausgestatteter Arbeitsplatz mit Blick auf die Ostsee oder citynah in Hamburg-Altona
  • Home-Office möglich, egal wo Du wohnst

Das ist der richtige Job wenn Du Bock hast auf

  • Start-up-Feeling
  • Team-Work
  • Gestalten und Gewinnen

title: Mobile Software Engineer, Senior
description:
We’re looking to grow our product development team!

Mobile Software Engineer, Senior

For over twelve years Flexoptix has been a successful provider for transceiver solutions. With over 50 colleagues, we occupy a growing niche that we have successfully disrupted and defined through our unconventional approach.

You will be part of our development team, not just limited to software development using the latest technologies, but also finding new challenges, as well as solutions for our company.

We hope for your support with:

  • Design of innovative software solutions
  • Coding our apps

What you bring to the table:

  • Passion for software development; ideally you’d contribute to open-source projects
  • A remote workplace, since we're on a pandemic remote working schedule
  • The ability to work at the office in Darmstadt once the pandemic isn't a challenge anymore
  • Willingness to shape our self-organizing team
  • Skills in Swift and a great interest in SwiftUI and Apple design guidelines
  • You want to get into Android development and can tell us if Kotlin is worth considering
  • You’re a Linux Guru and know how to use a shell
  • You already have experience with one or more of the following scripting languages: Lua, JavaScript, Python and Bash
  • You are pleased that everything is committed through git and you would like to help us with the documentation in our Atlassian products

What you can expect from us: We’re a pragmatic bunch of cowboys who think outside the box, which helps us to find creative solutions for technical problems. We offer a lot of freedom as well as opportunities to Influence our processes, though with great power comes great responsibility. This freedom also includes the choice of tools and materials, as well as ways of personal development (conferences, workshops, teachings, webinars).

Apply now! We’re looking forward to meeting you in person. 😷
how_to_apply: Please send your application to our HR Department via email: jobs@flexoptix.net.

title: Developer ART-DECOR
description:
Is het jouw uitdaging om als Developer (Front/Back-End) onze ART-Decor omgeving perfect op orde te krijgen en houden? Wil jij je steentje bijdragen in de standaardisatie in de zorg? Dan maken wij graag kennis met jou. Twijfel niet en solliciteer direct!

Nictiz heeft voor haar locatie in Den Haag een vacature voor een

Developer ART-DECOR

Ter uitbreiding van het Toolingcentrum van Nictiz zijn wij op zoek naar ART-Decor DeveloperS (Front/Back-End) die meewerken aan de (door)ontwikkeling van onze ART-DECOR omgeving.

Wat ga je doen als Developer ART-DECOR? ART-DECOR is een open source ontwikkelingstool, wat door Nictiz gebruikt wordt bij het opstellen, beheren en beschikbaar stellen van informatiestandaarden. ART-DECOR wordt intern en extern intensief gebruikt. Nictiz wil de verdere ontwikkeling van ART-DECOR met voorrang aanpakken.

Als Front-End Developer wordt het jouw taak om te werken aan een noodzakelijke platformverbetering, maar ook het vergroten van de gebruiksvriendelijkheid en uitbreiding van functionaliteit. Deze verbeteringen moeten goed aansluiten op de eisen en wensen van gebruikers. Ook zal je een rol spelen bij het realiseren van Nictiz specifieke wensen.

Als Back-End Developer wordt het jouw taak om te werken aan de doorontwikkeling van ons platform, waaronder API ontwikkeling. Onze back-end bestaat uit NoSQL database (eXist-db), XQuery, JSON/SML en OpenAPI (OAS). Naast het ontwikkelen, ben je ook verantwoordelijk voor het testen én documenteren van de ontwikkelde functionaliteit.

Om tot de juiste oplossingen te komen, werken wij niet alleen als team samen, maar ook met andere belanghebbende, zoals de Internationale Expertgroep. Voor meer informatie https://www.nictiz.nl/standaardisatie/art-decor/

Wat breng je mee?

  • HBO opleiding op het gebied informatiekunde is een pre;
  • Als Back-end developer: Ervaring met XQuery, Open API, Git, REST en JSON;
  • Als Front-end: Ervaring met Vue.js, Git, REST en JSON;
  • Je bent communicatief vaardig (Nederlands en Engels) en klantgericht;
  • Je bent in staat zelfstandig te functioneren;
  • Uitstekend analytisch vermogen.

De volgende kennis is een pré, zeker geen must:

  • Kennis van en ervaring met informatiestandaarden in de zorg;
  • Kennis en ervaring met FHIR;
  • Kennis en ervaring met terminologiestelsels zoals SNOMED en LOINC.

Wat biedt Nictiz jou?

  • Een mooi, marktconform salaris;
  • Aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals een premievrij pensioen, eindejaarsuitkering, korting op ziektekostenverzekering;
  • Een jaarlijks persoonlijk opleidingsbudget van 5% van je bruto jaarsalaris;
  • Een jaarcontract voor 32 – 40 uur met mogelijkheid tot verlenging en aansluitend uitzicht op vast dienstverband;
  • Een gedreven en enthousiast team, dat samenwerking hoog in het vaandel heeft en vol ambitie zit;
  • Een fijne werksfeer met ruimte voor reflectie.

Over Nictiz Nictiz is de landelijke, onafhankelijke kennisorganisatie die zich inzet voor digitale informatie-uitwisseling in de zorg. Nictiz doet dit onder meer door het gebruiksgericht ontwikkelen en het beheren van informatiestandaarden in opdracht van en samen met de partijen in de zorg. Nictiz signaleert en adviseert partijen in de zorg over informatie-uitwisseling en over (toekomstige) nationale en internationale ontwikkelingen.
how_to_apply:
We maken graag ruimte voor jouw expertise!

Meer informatie Voor meer informatie over de functie of de selectieprocedure kun je contact opnemen met onze recruiter, Audrey van der Linde, via 06 2120 5164 of werving@nictiz.nl.

Solliciteren op de functie van Developer ART-DECOR Geen vragen meer, maar wil je direct solliciteren? Upload dan snel je Curriculum Vitae en motivatiebrief via onze sollicitatiepagina.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

title: Backend Developer (m/w/d) - Java (Spring Boot)
description:
BLVRD ist die erste Online-Plattform für lokale Mode. Mit unserer Cross-Platform-App revolutionieren wir die Art, wie Menschen lokal Mode shoppen und arbeiten hier bereits mit großen Namen aus der Branche zusammen. Unser Ziel ist es, dem lokalen Handel wieder auf die Beine zu helfen und Paketmüll durch Online-Retouren zu reduzieren.

Gemeinsam mit dem Team steuerst du die Weiterentwicklung unseres Backends hin zu einer Plug&Play-Lösung, um die Anbindung neuer Händler iterativ zu vereinfachen. Dabei bist du bei uns Teil eines crossfunktionalen Teams, in dem jeder liebt, was er tut und sein Bestes gibt - für das große Ganze.

DEINE AUFGABEN

  • Du entwickelst Services für den Import und das Mapping der Produkt- & Bestandsdaten lokaler Händler
  • Du entwickelst skalierbare Micro-Services, die schnell wachsende Nutzerzahlen unterstützen können
  • Du unterstützt bei der Konzeption und Entwicklung unserer Full-Service Lösung zur Digitalisierung des Modehandels (Produkt- & Bestandsdatenaktualisierung)
  • Du unterstützt bei der Konzeption & Entwicklung unseres internen App-CMS

DEINE SKILLS

  • Du hast mindestens 2 Jahre Erfahrung mit Java-Entwicklung (Spring Boot)
  • Du kennst dich mit Datenbanksystemen wie MongoDB und PostgreSQL aus
  • Du siehst in Problemen keine Hindernisse, sondern Chancen für dich persönlich, dein Team und BLVRD
  • Du triffst schnell, smarte Entscheidungen und wägst das Risiko intelligent ab
  • Du verfügst über eine ausgeprägte ‘Hands-on’ Mentalität, du liebst es, mit anzupacken und Erfolge zu sehen
  • Nice-To-Have: Erfahrung mit Firebase, GraphQL und/oder Elastic Search

BENEFITS

  • Die Möglichkeit, die erste SaaS-Plattform für lokale Einkaufserlebnisse mit aufzubauen
  • Ein junges Team mit starkem Zusammenhalt und flachen Hierarchien
  • Start-up-Mentalität: dynamische Atmosphäre und großartiger Teamspirit.
  • Kreative Freiheit und den Raum, diese zu leben, ob remote oder bei uns im Office mit Blick über Hannover.
  • Exponentielle Lernkurve – BLVRD wächst rasant und das gleiche erwarten wir von dir. Du stehst nie still, du wirst permanent gechallenged, lernst aus deinen Fehlern a la Fail Fast and Often.
  • Ein top motiviertes Team, das dafür brennt, eine nachhaltige Alternative zum ,,Establishment“ der Online-Pure-Player im Mode-Bereich zu bieten, ohne Paketmüll und Retouren.

INTERESSE GEWECKT? Dann steck deine Zeit nicht in ein Anschreiben, sondern schick uns deinen CV und Links zu deinen letzten Projekten an hello@blvrd.de

title: Java ontwikkelaar Opsporing (FOV)
description:
Java ontwikkelaar Opsporing (FOV)

Als Java ontwikkelaar bij het domein Opsporing zit je bovenop onze meest cruciale informatievoorzieningsdiensten voor de uitvoerende politiecollega’s. Het bouwen en onderhouden van centrale politiesystemen en producten die cruciaal zijn voor het politiewerk op straat en in de opsporing: dat is wat jij doet als Java ontwikkelaar bij het Productiehuis in Odijk.

Wat ga je doen? De verregaande digitalisering van de samenleving vraagt om een kentering in het denken en werken van de politie én om optimale informatievoorziening. Waar sporen zich vroeger hoofdzakelijk beperkten tot fysieke resten zoals bloed of vingerafdrukken, heeft de hedendaagse criminaliteit vrijwel altijd ook een digitale component. En die wordt letterlijk met de dag groter en zwaarwegender. Willen we die criminaliteit terugdringen, dan is het van cruciaal belang om continu vernieuwende ICT te ontwikkelen. Als Java ontwikkelaar binnen het Opsporing domein speel jij hierin een zeer belangrijke rol. Jij ontwikkelt en beheert samen met je andere DevOps teamleden bestaande en nieuwe applicaties. Als ervaren ontwikkelaar voer jij de regie over diverse programmeeropdrachten.

Jij pakt je verantwoordelijkheid bij het:

  • (door)ontwikkelen van centrale politiesystemen;
  • uitleveren van software conform kwaliteits- en performance-eisen;
  • verzorgen van (installatie)scripts;
  • ondersteunen van het Ops-team bij het uitvoeren van installaties;
  • adviseren over toe te passen methodes en technieken.

Waar ga je werken? Als Java ontwikkelaar bij het domein Opsporing maak je deel uit van het Productiehuis. Binnen het Productiehuis zijn zeven productielijnen ingericht; elke productielijn bedient een specifiek domein. Deze vacature betreft een functie binnen de productielijn Opsporing. In deze productielijn werken meerdere DevOps teams aan Opsporing-applicaties in vijf clusters. Jij gaat werken in het Cluster Forensische Opsporing en Verhoorregistratie (FOV). De DevOps teams werken nauw samen met de Product Owner om de wensen, behoeften en problemen van de eindgebruikers te realiseren en/of op te lossen.

Wie ben jij? Er wordt verwacht dat je een teamspeler bent want we werken agile/scrum. Je bent flexibel, open en eerlijk en je neemt je verantwoordelijkheid als persoon en als teamlid. Een proactieve houding en de juiste communicatieve skills zijn hierbij een vereiste. Jij bent iemand met een frisse blik, iemand die open staat voor veranderingen en de drive heeft om continu de dienstverlening te verbeteren. Je bent ondernemend, creatief en wilt met jouw ideeën graag iets bijdragen aan het politiewerk. Je staat open voor nieuwe zaken, bent van nature nieuwsgierig en leergierig. Werken in een dynamische en soms hectische omgeving past bij jou als persoon. Daarnaast ben je goed in staat om je eigen werk te organiseren en durf je kritische vragen te stellen. Je kunt over de grenzen van het eigen vakgebied heen kijken en verbindingen leggen. Je hebt een oplossend denkvermogen.

Verder beschik je over:

  • hbo-diploma, bijvoorbeeld in de richting (technische) informatica of software-engineering;
  • werkervaring met Agile-, CI-CD en DevOps omgevingen;
  • up-to-date ervaring met Java 8 of hoger;
  • werkervaring met Oracle WebLogic Server 12 of JBoss EAP 7;
  • werkervaring met:
  • in frontend én backend ontwikkelen;
  • Java enterprise applicaties;
  • microservices bij voorkeur in een cloud omgeving;
  • Jenkins, Maven, SonarQube, Bitbucket, Jira en Confluence;
  • werkervaring met testautomatisering, bij voorkeur met Fitnesse en Cucumber;
  • bij voorkeur werkervaring met Springboot framework of Quarkus en secure software development, SAST, OWASP en DAST tools.

Wat wij bieden De standplaats is Odijk. Er is ruimte voor 5 fte. Het betreft een functie voor 36 uur per week.

Omdat goede mensen belangrijk zijn binnen de politie investeren we in jouw toekomst. We bieden uitgebreide ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden en een vaste aanstelling, waarbij een proeftijd van 1 jaar van toepassing is.

Verder kun je het volgende van ons verwachten:

  • een bruto maandsalaris van minimaal € 2.866,- en maximaal € 4.624, - (schaal 10 Bbp) op basis van een 36-urige werkweek;
  • 8% vakantie- en 8,33% eindejaarsuitkering;
  • goede pensioenregeling en betaald ouderschapsverlof (meer info over verlof, regelingen en mogelijkheden).

De formele functie binnen het functiegebouw van de politie is bedrijfsvoeringspecialist B, werkterrein informatie- en communicatietechnologie.
how_to_apply:
Bel of mail met Katja Damming, ICT Recruiter, (06 - 53 29 83 17, katja.damming@politie.nl) als je meer informatie over de functie wilt hebben.

Solliciteer uiterlijk 8 april 2021 via de sollicitatiebutton.

Wat verder belangrijk is • Een veiligheidsonderzoek maakt deel uit van de selectieprocedure. • Zonder IT'ers zijn we nergens. Ben jij expert in IT? Lees alles over o.a. data science, legaal hacken of cybersecurity en test je digitale skills in de Cybercrime challenge op it.kombijdepolitie.nl • De politie zet in op vernieuwing en cultuurverschillen binnen teams. Divers samengestelde teams presteren beter. Daarom werken we hard aan een open en veilige cultuur waarin divers talent tot bloei komt.

title: Lead Programmer
description:
Company Description

We're the studio behind the hit franchise Chivalry: Medieval Warfare. At Torn Banner we understand that long, hard hours are not conducive to being a happy, healthy person. Combine this idea with a flat studio structure and profit sharing and you've got ideals that promote a positive, low stress environment to help us create awesome games. As a small team of developers, each individual has a huge impact on the final product that we put out, so we put emphasis on being open with each other, giving/receiving critical feedback, and not letting an false sense of authority cloud our vision. The more eyes and input that we have from different disciplines and personality types, the better our releases will be.

Job Description

Torn Banner Studios is looking for a Lead Programmer to manage the programming team. The ideal candidate is passionate about providing high-level direction, supporting a team of engineers, and getting their hands dirty with day-to-day development.

You are an accomplished engineer that enjoys collaborating closely with the engineering team to build a technically excellent game across multiple platforms.

Qualifications

Responsibilities:

  • Lead and manage a programming team at technical and personnel level
  • Provide estimate time to complete programming task/objectives and be committed to meet them
  • Help in setting up best practices for coding and conduct regular code reviews
  • Encourage and help guide the creation of technical design documents
  • Setup a process to review the game on a regular interval during development cycle and identify area of improvement
  • Collaborate directors, designers and production to ensure efficient development practices
  • Ensure that solid coding practices, technical briefs and code reviews are maintained
  • Maintain regular internal communications and encourage a positive and ambitious team atmosphere
  • Demonstrate good leadership, enthusiasm and sense of commitment
  • Take responsibility for recruitment, on-boarding, development and professional training of the programming team
  • Propose solutions to improve the development of projects in the studio
  • Maintain a strong understanding of multiplayer FPS games

Requirements

  • Proficiency in C++
  • At least 5 years professional video game programming experience
  • A strong and efficient communicator with excellent management skills
  • A bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent.
  • Previous leadership/mentorship experience, or leadership interest and potential
  • A good knowledge of programming languages and software engineering practices
  • Experience developing AAA titles on multiple platforms
  • Experience with Unreal Engine 4 or other large engines
  • Comfortable wandering around unexplored game design territory, and excited to help refine ideas i-into shippable features

Bonus

  • Previous experience as a Lead Programmer on a shipped game
  • Previous experience in small/medium sized development studios

Additional Information

Portfolio and résumé required for any application.

Benefits & Perks

  • Profit sharing
  • 4 weeks Paid vacation
  • A no crunching policy
  • Relocation assistance
  • Flexible schedule
  • Weekly happy hour
  • Healthcare & benefits
how_to_apply: Click here for the application form!

title: Lead software engineer
description:
lead software engineer

Het doel van het Programma Vernieuwend Registreren? Een landelijk platform realiseren waar al onze applicaties voor agenten op straat samenkomen. Met als resultaat: nog effectievere opsporing en handhaving. Als lead software engineer bouw je vanuit Odijk mee aan dit platform en focus je op het refactoren, innoveren en upgraden van de applicaties. Zo draag je bij aan een veiliger Nederland.

Wat ga je doen? Je hebt een belangrijke rol in het tot stand brengen en up and running houden van het operationeel platform van de politie. Een flinke klus, want het platform telt ruim 50.000 gebruikers en combineert veel gegevens. Denk aan digitale informatie over aangiftes, executie en signalering, boetes, veroordelingen, straffen en daderinformatie. Mede dankzij jouw inzet kunnen agenten die gegevens snel en via hun mobiel verkrijgen. Zo verbeter je het opsporings- en handhavingsproces.

Samen met je team pas je nieuwe technieken toe en ontwikkel en beheer je applicaties. Jullie zijn ook (mede)verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen, realiseren, uitdragen en bewaken van de visie op het platform. Zo vormen je collega’s en jij de technische basis waarop ook andere IT-developmentteams software kunnen bouwen. Doen er zich complexe problemen voor? Dan lossen jullie die op. Daarbij maak je onder andere gebruik van reactive programming.

De ene dag werk je aan generieke componenten en de andere dag buig je je over een complex framework. Daarnaast geef je inhoudelijke support aan collega-developers. Je ontwikkelt de domain-specific language waarmee de featureteams Resource Description Framework-data kunnen ophalen, aanmaken én manipuleren. Verder werk je met backend-engineers aan de communicatie tussen client en backend via REST-services en WebSockets. Je zorgt er te allen tijde voor dat je code onderhoudbaar en goed getest is, zodat anderen er optimaal gebruik van kunnen maken.

Waar ga je werken? Je werkt in het Productiehuis van de Dienst ICT. Hier ontwikkelen multidisciplinaire DevOps-teams snel en flexibel nieuwe functionaliteiten voor de operationele politiediensten. Binnen het Productiehuis maak jij deel uit van het Platformteam. Dit bestaat uit vijftien hardwerkende en gepassioneerde mensen van verschillende leeftijden. Zo is de jongste 33 en de oudste 64. Negen posities zijn extern opgevuld, maar we willen graag meer interne kandidaten verwelkomen om de kennis te borgen. Waar we heel blij van worden? Nieuwe technologieën benutten! Verder is het goed om te weten dat het weleens kan voorkomen dat je buiten kantoortijd wordt opgeroepen. Het werk van de politie gaat immers 24/7 door.

Wie ben jij? Een IT-professional met liefde voor het vak. Je bent nieuwsgierig en constant op zoek naar mogelijkheden om nieuwe technologieën in te zetten. Daarnaast houd je ervan om resultaten te boeken en stel je jezelf regelmatig de vraag: hoe kan dit nog beter? Jouw creatieve ideeën deel je graag. Bovendien ben je een echte teamspeler en pas je je gemakkelijk aan wanneer de situatie daarom vraagt. Verder heb je:

  • een hbo-diploma in de richting van ICT;
  • minimaal vier jaar relevante ervaring als core clientside-engineer;
  • minimaal twee jaar relevante ervaring met TypeScript;
  • kennis van Angular 2+, Node.js en RxJS;
  • kennis van Gang of Four (GoF) en reactive programming design patterns.

Wat wij bieden De standplaats is Odijk. Er is ruimte voor 1 fte. Het betreft een functie voor 36 uur per week. Omdat goede mensen belangrijk zijn binnen de politie investeren we in jouw toekomst. We bieden uitgebreide ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden en een vaste aanstelling, waarbij een proeftijd van één jaar van toepassing is.

Verder kun je het volgende van ons verwachten:

  • een bruto maandsalaris van minimaal € 3.502,- en maximaal € 5.228,- (schaal 11 Bbp) op basis van een 36-urige werkweek;
  • 8% vakantie- en 8,33% eindejaarsuitkering;
  • goede pensioenregeling en betaald ouderschapsverlof (meer info over verlof, regelingen en mogelijkheden).

De formele functie binnen het functiegebouw van de politie is bedrijfsvoeringspecialist C, werkterrein informatie- en communicatietechnologie.
how_to_apply:
Neem contact op met Donja Huidar, Recruiter ICT als je meer informatie over de functie wilt hebben via 06 - 18 63 45 09 of donja.huidar@politie.nl

Solliciteer uiterlijk 24 maart 2021 via de sollicitatiebutton.

Wat verder belangrijk is • Een veiligheidsonderzoek P maakt deel uit van de selectieprocedure. • Zonder IT'ers zijn we nergens. Ben jij expert in IT? Lees alles over o.a. data science, legaal hacken of cybersecurity en test je digitale skills in de Cybercrime challenge op it.kombijdepolitie.nl • De politie zet in op vernieuwing en cultuurverschillen binnen teams. Divers samengestelde teams presteren beter. Daarom werken we hard aan een open en veilige cultuur waarin divers talent tot bloei komt

title: Software Engineer
description:
This is a unique role that offers broad exposure to software engineering and data science. We are eager to find underrepresented candidates who are early in their career and don’t want to choose between engineering or data science.

Working with data science and engineering, you will be deeply enmeshed in the critical nuances of disambiguation, normalization, standardization and other ETL skills. You will also have the opportunity to work in all stages of our software process from researching data sources to developing data pipelines and building business intelligence visualization tools.

Responsibilities

  • Design and build data pipelines
  • Run and iterate data science experiments in the cloud and in a production environment
  • Support business intelligence and data science needs via visualization/reporting

Background/Experience

  • Undergraduate CS degree or equivalent; 3-5 years professional experience
  • Fluent in python; the ideal candidate will be comfortable with web programming, consuming APIs, data wrangling, SQL, etc.
  • Experience with python pandas, scikit-learn, numpy and NVDIA’s CUDA and visualization libraries such as seaborn, plotly, etc. strongly preferred
  • Experience working with large tabular (>100m rows) datasets a plus
  • Familiarity with basic statistical concepts
  • Curiosity for insurance and autonomous technology applied to transportation/trucking
  • Entrepreneurial mindset and comfort with ambiguity

Benefits

Koffie is an insurance company purpose built for the autonomous vehicle era. We are taking transportation insurance out of the dark ages by using modern technology to deliver instant policies based on advanced safety and autonomous technology. As an InsurTech, Koffie is free from legacy systems and inefficient processes, our AI-driven predictive models deliver a reimagined insurance experience for fleets. We believe strongly in diversity of thought which comes from different backgrounds and experiences.

Our vision is to align incentives across fleets, technology providers, brokers and the automotive industry. By catalyzing the adoption of safety technology, we positively impact road safety and facilitate a more efficient supply chain. We’re backed by top-tier VCs in the fintech and mobility sectors.

If you're ready to work obsessively with us to make insurance better, faster, more efficient and build products for the next 100 years of mobility, we want to hear from you, regardless of where you live.

For US employees we offer a competitive salary, stock options, unlimited vacation, 100% employer paid health, vision and dental plans, commuter benefits and discounted fitness classes, generous WFH stipend, personal learning/training (for professional and industry certification) and conference budget. For remote hires outside the US, we are unable to provide some of these benefits.

Although this position is WFH, we envision meeting face-to-face as a team every 6-8 weeks for several days once things return to 'normal.'

Hiring process for this role is as follows: initial screen by hiring manager, coding challenge (administered by iMocha), Zoom screen, Zoom technical interview, Zoom interview with additional team members, then offer. We hope to have candidates go from submission to offer in under two weeks.
how_to_apply: Please visit https://apply.workable.com/koffie-labs/ to learn more and apply!

title: Android Software Engineer (Remote)
description:
Onenigma is a fully remote, flexible, ultra-casual, and forward-thinking software studio that works on new concepts, projects, and products we care about with people and companies we strongly believe in. Onenigma has worked with various companies over the years like AirBnB, Cognito, Udacity, Bloom, Tranche, Peapod, as well as many more to build new concepts and ideas. We always have liked to fly under the radar by building products used by millions around the world without seeking attention, because we simply really enjoy making cool and intuitive things.

This position focuses on both Android and occasionally web stacks. We work with leaders in the cryptocurrency, finance, and emerging technology spaces to deliver high impact products that have served as the backbone for many industries. This position will expose you to a number of different products, fields, and concepts that require adaptive thinking. This position also allows for you to work on an idea or hobbyist project alongside company projects. We are a constantly evolving company, always looking to take unorthodox approaches to new ideas and ventures and love working with people who think the same way.

You will:

  • Work closely with designers and engineers to be solely responsible for maintaining existing and creating new Android libraries and applications
  • Create cutting-edge front end user experiences that everyone actually​ enjoys using
  • Learn new technologies and practices required to stay up to date with the latest developments and security requirements

You have:

  • 2+ years of prior experience developing/releasing Android applications in Kotlin and Java
  • Understanding of Android framework components and their lifecycles
  • Prior experience working with product, design, and other developers to create strong products
  • Experience with test-driven development
  • Strong communication skills
  • Ability to self-manage time and development targets
  • Open-mindness and adaptability to shifting to new products or priorities
  • Desire to improve on existing skills and learn new ones

Bonus points:

  • Some prior experience with Full-Stack Development
  • Experience with React
  • Strong sense of design, both big picture and nano details
  • Prefer simple solutions over complicated ones
  • Have a desire to work on products in a variety of different industries from cryptocurrency to insurance, and even identity verification technologies
  • Enjoys participating in occasional banter about things like life, hobbies, and crypto
  • Some history working in a fully remote environment

Perks:

  • Close knit, family-like work culture
  • Fully and indefinitely remote
  • Unlimited vacation days
  • Completely flexible working hours and work schedule
  • Top coverage health insurance
  • Life insurance
  • Dental insurance
  • Vision insurance
  • Visa sponsorship

Onenigma is an equal opportunity employer and participates in the US Federal E-Verify program.

title: Senior Application Engineer
description:
*This position has multiple openings and we anticipate will remain open for applications until 9am Pacific time, April 30th, 2021. Please expect an update on your application in approximately two weeks from submission.

Truss is a software consultancy known for trust, pragmatism, autonomy, and expertise. We believe strong relationships with our clients, contractors and employees is fundamental to doing great work.

Truss is tackling tough technical problems for the private sector and government. We implement and advocate modern development practices to build software and streamline infrastructure. As a Truss engineer you will facilitate bringing our values to our clients and help drive toward understanding what their end users truly need.

We are seeking empathetic, curious, and quick-learning engineers to join our team. A position with Truss will allow you to use your rich skill-set to build an energetic yet balanced environment with a team of curious, helpful people.

Here's what we hope you'll bring:

  • Great communication! Including thoughtful listening skills, the ability to express complex ideas clearly and succinctly, and the ability to communicate well in writing.
  • An adaptive, empathetic, collaborative and positive mindset.
  • Excitement to experiment with new technologies and best practices.
  • The ability to think holistically about software delivery and engineering issues.
  • Methodical approach to solving problems and ability to express solutions to coworkers.
  • Have held at least one engineering/infrastructure position post-educationInitiative with a bias for action.
  • Experience leading and actively mentoring junior engineers.
  • Technology-agnostic approach to solving key problems.

Truss encourages applicants from a wide range of experience to apply, including those with backgrounds in application, UI, backend and/or frontend engineering, as well as generalists. We would like you to have experience in at least 3-4 of the following:

  • Thoughtful, process-oriented approach to engineering, testing and agile software development.
  • Leading software delivery teams through agile ceremonies.
  • Proficiency in a commonly used programming language such as JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Ruby, Go, Java, etc.
  • Web frameworks such as React, Vue, Angular, Rails, Django, Flask, Express, etc.
  • Modern web technologies such as HTML, CSS.
  • Best practices such as accessibility, progressive enhancement, etc.
  • Common API design patterns like REST or GraphQL.
  • Common databases (MySQL, postgreSQL) and data schema design.
  • Converting design wireframes or mockups into working code.
  • Structuring projects/applications using technology and process to enable junior engineers to be more productive.
  • Security-first software development (examples: designing identity and authorization systems).
  • Designing systems for the cloud.

If you have more experience than is reflected here, that’s great! We’ll be pleased to exercise your broader/deeper skill set. We value inclusion and welcome diverse viewpoints.

In this position you will:

  • Deliver timely, high quality solutions to specific engineering problems.
  • Create automated tests or be willing to learn to do so.
  • Mentor and cross-train with other engineers via design discussions and code reviews.
  • Help architect new systems and changes to existing systems to support new functionality and broaden impact to clients.
  • Work cross-functionally on project teams to form and drive technical decisions to completion.
  • Evaluate and select tools to meet project needs without creating unnecessary technical debt.
  • Collaborate closely across practices such as Product and Design to build solutions that keep the end-user in mind.
  • Build team dynamics that empowers technical teams to set and advocate for best practices and standards.

The salary range for this role is $166,500 - $180,000.

Eligibility: You must be eligible to work in the US. Unfortunately, we are unable to sponsor work visas at this time.

** A note from Truss: We know you’re likely experiencing a lot of disruption as our nation (and our world) responds to COVID-19 - we’re experiencing it, too. There are two things we want you to know when it comes to hiring. First, we’re financially stable. We have a variety of well-established government contracts that we expect to continue over the next few years. Also, we’re winning new work, and we have a robust rainy day fund. Second, during video interviews, you’ll likely see more of our human side. Family members, partners, kids and pets are home with some of us! We promise to be present and engaged, but we may be a little...harried. It’s OK if you are, too - we understand that everyone is experiencing extra stress right now. If you have any questions along the way, please let us know, and stay healthy and safe. **
how_to_apply: Please follow this link to submit your application! https://bit.ly/2OrprxA We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Back-End Web & Application Engineer
description:
Simply put: Nebo’s engineering team gets things done. That usually looks like using the art of code to solve problems and build solutions for clients and coworkers alike. We don’t get hung up on what hasn’t been done — we’re all about what we can do. We’re looking for driven teammates who are ready to jump in and do the same.

When you close your eyes, what do you see? Rows of clean code? Pages of wireframes? CMS back-ends? If that sounds about right, you just might be the person for Nebo’s back-end engineer role.

Your brain is wired for manipulating data and you’re equipped with the skills to maintain and develop features for existing web applications and websites — and build complex web applications either from scratch or within existing frameworks.

Collaboration is key at Nebo, and you should be able to participate in project planning and tactical direction with your team as well as build internal tools to help support other Nebo departments.

We’re looking for someone with 2-5 years of professional software experience and a computer science degree or equivalent experience.

About the Position:

As a Back-End Web and Application Engineer, you’d be joining our Back-End Engineering team, which performs a variety of tasks, including:

  • Participating in project planning and tactical direction
  • Working with and developing CMS back-ends
  • Maintenance and feature development for existing web applications/websites
  • Building complex web applications either from scratch or within existing frameworks
  • Building internal tools to help support other Nebo departments

Here are some of the technologies we use on a daily basis:

  • Ruby / Rails
  • PHP
  • Postgres and MySQL
  • Git / GitLab
  • Nebo CMS (our in-house Content Management System built and maintained by our team!)

Skills Required:

  • 2+ years of web development experience
  • Experience with an object-oriented, back-end web development language (PHP, RoR, etc)
  • Experience with creating & customizing content management systems (Wordpress, Magento, etc)
  • Experience using version control to manage coding projects
  • A solid portfolio demonstrating back-end web application/website development capability
  • Written and verbal communication skills

The things that will set you apart (AKA Bonus Skills):

  • Experience with E-commerce platforms (Magento, osCommerce, Shopify, etc)
  • Experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript
  • Knowledge of SEO best practices

This is a full-time position and compensation is dependent upon experience. We're currently working remotely due to COVID-19, but going forward this position will be based in our office located in Atlanta, Georgia.

Nebo's Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion

As a human-centered agency, we believe in uplifting our community and advancing society through inclusive business practices. We're dedicated to providing equal opportunities and equal access to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, ethnic or national origin, gender, genetic information, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, and veteran’s status.

Thank you for your interest in Nebo!

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
